com.shelbot.blocks

Class Daddy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shelbot.blocks.Block
      • com.shelbot.blocks.Daddy

  • public abstract class Daddy
extends Block
    This class models a Daddy (daddy block). It can be used in the ProgrammingWindow to have drag and drop programming with Processing PApplet. These type of blocks require a block within them in order to be perform its operations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.shelbot.blocks.Block

        Block.BlockType, Block.Location, Block.ParamType, Block.SecondaryBlock, Block.ShadowBlock

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.shelbot.blocks.Block

        blockWidth, daddyWidth

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Daddy(float x, float y, java.awt.Color color, java.lang.String text, boolean isLastBlock, Block.ParamType paramType, Block.SecondaryBlock secondary)
      Creates a new instance of a Daddy object with a starting x and y coordinate, a Color for the block, the text representing the block, whether the block is for ending, the parameter type it will take in, and the block's heirarchy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Daddy

        public Daddy(float x,
             float y,
             java.awt.Color color,
             java.lang.String text,
             boolean isLastBlock,
             Block.ParamType paramType,
             Block.SecondaryBlock secondary)
        Creates a new instance of a Daddy object with a starting x and y coordinate, a Color for the block, the text representing the block, whether the block is for ending, the parameter type it will take in, and the block's heirarchy.
        Parameters:
        x - main x-coordinate of the block
        y - main y-coordinate of the block
        color - the color the block will be filled with
        text - states what the block does
        isLastBlock - defines whether the block is the last block in script
        paramType - the parameter type of the block
        secondary - the hierarchy stance of the block (includes control blocks)
